Floor 3564: A handbook on how to understand the manual to run the projector

Edited July 20, 2023 by Aerodynamic Kerbal
New page
Floor 3565: a suspicious, scuffed, and dubious hardware store that sells things like iron fists (to rule with)

Floor 3566: A single console with a pair of glowing buttons. As you face the console and gaze upon it, the button to your right glows a dark blue, the button on your left glows green. A small placard on the top center of the console reads: Press one button. There is no other text on the console or in the room aside from the floor number. You receive no other context.

100707202023

the condole auto destroys any manuals, handbooks, guidebooks or any other documentation that tries to give context, physical or electronic.

100807202023

100907202023

Floor 3567: An empty hall with a caption above the door: "Who needs manuals?"
Floor 3568: A silly cat

Floor 3569: A shy, adorable and cute kitten

161707202023

Floor 3570: A sillicone sillycat.

Spoiler

Floor 3571: endless portions of fried cod. There are no condiments or sides or anything other than the fried cod.

234707202023

Floor 3572: MoH and SoF in addition to CoD.

Spoiler

CoD = Call of Duty

MoH = Medal of Honor

SoF = Soldier of Fortune

 

Edited July 21, 2023 by kerbiloid

Floor 3573: This floor is a dull gray and not all there. You realise that you have arrived too early and that it is still being rendered. Which means that each floor is being procedurally generated just before you arrive. This means you are unlikely to know what could be next and that there may be no end to this building.

You wait patiently till it is finished and textured, it turns out to be a grand bathing house with what looks like marble for its floors and columns.

You get in the large pool of water, that is at a comfortably warm temperature, and soak all your tensions away.

This should give the next floor time to finish before you arrive.
Floor 3574: Stuck in textures.
Floor 3575: Someone got the texture file upside down. This floor is colourful but nothing seems to be in the right place.
Floor 3576: A single-sided texture. No floor.

Floor 3577: you reach a wooden door. At first glance it seems rather unassuming. The door as you look at is fairly simple in construction. 2 wrought iron hinges on the left affix the door to the frame and a simple wrought iron knob is set in place on the right. With the confidence of a well practiced fighter you reach out with your left hand towards the knob. A bead of sweat forms on your half giant brow as your hand contacts the knob. You pause for a moment as you recall the words of the older elvish woman: “Beyond a door of wood and iron you will find….” The rest of her words fail to return as suddenly the door splinters as a giant owl bear bursts through. What do you do?

111907222023

Floor 3578: Sitting here and holding the end of the rope, which I was using attached to the door knob to open.
Yes, the door was mined with a trip-wire mine from inside, so the burst killed the owl bear.
Floor 3579: A Star Trek Universe Holo Deck. You program it to play an adventure that you have always dreamed of having and spend the next week playing it out.
Floor 3580: Grammar Police station. They politely inform you that holodeck is a compound word.

floor 3581: the top of the building

floor 5383: its a room based in the 60s and is a cafe... on the bottom floor... you cant get out of the door, all you can do is walk inside. its if this room was time traveled in
